Lateralus.Component Class

Uses
  • http://backbonejs.org/#Events
  • Lateralus.mixins
Defined in: scripts/lateralus.component.js:18

The constructor for this method should not be called directly. Instead, use the addComponent mixin method:

var App = Lateralus.beget(function () {
  Lateralus.apply(this, arguments);
});

var app = new App(document.getElementById('app'));
var component = app.addComponent(Lateralus.Component);

console.log(component instanceof Lateralus.Component); // true

  • viewOptions Object

    The options Object to pass to the View constructor.

  • [opt_parentComponent] Lateralus.Component optional

    The parent component of this component, if any.

Methods

_super

(
  • methodName
  • [args]
)
Any

Inherited from Lateralus.mixins: scripts/lateralus.mixins.js:149

Call a method of the next object on the prototype chain where it is present. This method is prepended with an underscore to prevent conflict with the ES6 super keyword.

Lateralus.Component.extend({
  initialize: function () {
    // The same as Lateralus.Component.prototype.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
    this._super('initialize', arguments);
  }
});

Parameters:

  • methodName String
  • [args] Arguments optional

    the arguments array from the calling function.

Returns:

Any:

Whatever the called method returned.

addComponent

(
  • Component
  • [viewOptions]
  • [options]
)
Lateralus.Component

Inherited from Lateralus.mixins: scripts/lateralus.mixins.js:21

Add a subcomponent to a Lateralus or Lateralus.Component instance.

var App = Lateralus.beget(function () {
  Lateralus.apply(this, arguments);
});

var app = new App(document.getElementById('app'));
var component = app.addComponent(Lateralus.Component);
var subcomponent = component.addComponent(Lateralus.Component);

Parameters:

  • Component Lateralus.Component

    A constructor, not an instance.

  • [viewOptions] Object optional

    The options object to be passed along to the Component parameter's Lateralus.Component.View instance.

  • [options] Object optional

    Gets passed to the new Lateralus.Component instance.

Returns:

Lateralus.Component:

The component that was added.

emit

(
  • eventName
  • [args]
)

Inherited from Lateralus.mixins: scripts/lateralus.mixins.js:97

Components should never communicate directly with one another in order to maintain a loosely-coupled architecture. Instead, they should just broadcast general messages with the Backbone.Events API. emit facilitates this loose coupling by firing an event that bubbles throughout the app, depending on what calls it:

  • If this is called by a Lateralus.Component, this triggers an event on that Lateralus.Component as well as the central Lateralus instance.
  • If this is called by a Lateralus.Component.View, this triggers an event on that Lateralus.Component.View, the Lateralus.Component to which it belongs, and the central Lateralus instance.

This method has the same method signature as Backbone.Events.trigger.

Parameters:

  • eventName String

    The name of the event.

  • [args] ...any optional

    Any arguments to pass along to the listeners.

(
  • protoProps
)

Defined in scripts/lateralus.component.js:146

Create a Lateralus.Component subclass.

Parameters:

    • name String

      The name of this component it should have no whitespace.

    • [View] Lateralus.Component.View optional

      The Lateralus.Component.View to render this component with.

listenFor

(
  • event
  • callback
)

Inherited from Lateralus.mixins: scripts/lateralus.mixins.js:132

Listen for an event that is triggered on the central Lateralus instance and bind a function handler.

Parameters:

  • event String

    The name of the event to listen for.

  • callback Function

    The function handler to bind.

mixin

(
  • mixin
)

Defined in scripts/lateralus.component.js:179

Merge the properties of another object into this Lateralus.Component. If mixin has a function called initialize, it is called in the context of this Lateralus.Component.

Parameters:

  • mixin Object

    The object to mix in to this one.

mixins

Object | Array(Object) | Undefined

Defined in scripts/lateralus.component.js:72

If a Lateralus.Component has mixins defined on its prototype before it is instantiated, the objects within mixins will be merged into this Lateralus.Component at instantiation-time with mixin.

Default: undefined

name

String protected

Defined in scripts/lateralus.component.js:199

The name of this component. This is used internally by Lateralus.

parentComponent

Lateralus.Component | Undefined

Defined in scripts/lateralus.component.js:87

If this is a subcomponent of another Lateralus.Component, this property is a reference to the parent Lateralus.Component.

Default: undefined

View

Lateralus.Component.View | Undefined

Defined in scripts/lateralus.component.js:98

The Lateralus.Component.View constructor to use, if any. If this Lateralus.Component is intended to render to the DOM, View should be defined on the prototype before instantiating:

var ExtendedComponent = Lateralus.Component.extend({
  name: 'extended'
  ,View: Lateralus.Component.View
  ,template: '<div></div>'
});

Default: undefined

view

Lateralus.Component.View | Undefined

Defined in scripts/lateralus.component.js:114

If View is defined, this is an instance of that constructor.

Default: undefined
